meanings.definition: The edge or border of something.
meanings.sent1: She drew a line along the margin of the paper.
meanings.sent2: The cat walked along the margin of the garden.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel peeked over the margin of the tree trunk.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed against the margin of the cliff.
meanings.sent5: The margin of the lake sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: An amount by which something is won or falls short.
meanings.sent1: He won the game by a small margin.
meanings.sent2: The team lost by a narrow margin.
meanings.sent3: The margin of victory was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: She missed the target by a wide margin.
meanings.sent5: The margin of error was too high for accurate results.

meanings.definition: The difference between the cost and the selling price of a product.
meanings.sent1: The company's profit margin increased this quarter.
meanings.sent2: The margin on that product is very low.
meanings.sent3: She calculated the margin for the new product.
meanings.sent4: The margin for negotiation is slim.
meanings.sent5: The margin for error in pricing must be minimized.

meanings.definition: A blank space around the text on a page.
meanings.sent1: She wrote notes in the margin of her textbook.
meanings.sent2: The teacher made comments in the margin of the essay.
meanings.sent3: The margin of the page was filled with doodles.
meanings.sent4: He scribbled in the margin of the notebook.
meanings.sent5: The margin of the document was left blank for additional notes.
